    P.when('A', 'vote-parent-controller', 'reviews-controller',
            'review-comment-parent-controlller', 'psr-controller',
            'video-parent-controller').execute(
            function(A, VoteParentController, ReviewsController,
                    ReviewCommentsParentController,
                    PublicSharedRatingsController,
                    VideoParentController) {
                new VoteParentController(A);
                new ReviewsController(A);
                new ReviewCommentsParentController(A);
                new PublicSharedRatingsController(A);
                new VideoParentController(A);
            });
</script>
<link rel="stylesheet" href="http://z-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/vap/video/airy2/prod/2.0.1102.0/css/beacon._CB304902268_.css">
<script src="http://z-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/vap/video/airy2/prod/2.0.1102.0/js/airy.skin._CB304902270_.js"></script>
<input type="hidden" name="" value="http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/vap/video/airy2/prod/2.0.1102.0/flash/AiryBasicRenderer._CB304902271_.swf" id="video-swf-url"><script>
  P.when('A', 'review-image-asset-loader').execute(function(A, ReviewImageAssetLoader) {
      var imageAssetLoader = new ReviewImageAssetLoader(A);
      imageAssetLoader.loadAssets();
  });
</script><!-- btf pilu -->

  <script type='text/javascript'>
      window.$Nav && $Nav.declare('config.prefetchUrls', ["https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/authportal/common/images/amazon_logo_no-org_mid._V153387053_.png","https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/authportal/common/images/amznbtn-sprite03._V395592492_.png","https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/authportal/flex/reduced-nav/ap-flex-reduced-nav-2.0._V309092102_.js","https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/authportal/flex/reduced-nav/ap-flex-reduced-nav-2.1._V343920894_.css","https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/gno/sprites/global-sprite_bluebeacon-32-v1._V327533540_.png","https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/x-locale/common/buttons/sign-in-secure._V192194766_.gif","https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/x-locale/common/login/fwcim._V342128453_.js","https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/x-locale/common/transparent-pixel._V386942464_.gif"]);
window.$Nav && $Nav.declare('config.prefetch',function() {
    var pUrls = window.$Nav.getNow('config.prefetchUrls');
    if (window.amznJQ) amznJQ.addPL(pUrls);
    else if (window.P) P.when('A').execute(function (A) { A.preload(pUrls); });
});

        Free shipping with Amazon Prime</span></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="a-fixed-left-grid ratings-solicitation"><div class="a-fixed-left-grid-inner" style="padding-left:200px"><div class="a-fixed-left-grid-col a-col-right" style="padding-left:2%;*width:97.6%;float:left;"><div class="a-fixed-left-grid reviewSolicitation"><div class="a-fixed-left-grid-inner" style="padding-left:108px"><div class="a-fixed-left-grid-col a-col-left" style="width:108px;margin-left:-108px;_margin-left:-54px;float:left;"><script type="a-state" data-a-state="{&quot;key&quot;:&quot;reviews-rating-descriptions&quot;}">{"1":"I hate it","2":"I don't like it","3":"It's ok","4":"I like it","5":"I love it"}</script><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-small clearStars a-hidden a-text-bold"><span>Your rating</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span>(</span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="star-rating-clear-action" data-star-rating-clear-action="{}"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal" rel="cm_cr_pr_psr_rgt" href="#">Clear</a></span><span>)</span></span><span class="a-size-small rateYourItem  a-text-bold">Rate this item</span></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-declarative" data-action="star-rating-action" data-star-rating-action="{}"><span class="a-declarative" data-action="a-tooltip" data-a-tooltip="{&quot;position&quot;:&quot;triggerRight&quot;,&quot;content&quot;:&quot;&lt;span class=&#39;rating-description&#39;&gt;&lt;\/span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;span class=&#39;rating-pen-name&#39;&gt;&lt;\/span&gt;&lt;span class=&#39;rating-saved a-hidden&#39;&gt;Saved&lt;\/span&gt;&quot;}"><a class="a-link-normal" rel="cm_cr_pr_psr_rgt" href="#"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star-medium a-star-medium-0 ratingStars"></i></a></span></span></div></div><div class="a-spacing-top-mini a-fixed-left-grid-col a-col-right" style="padding-left:0%;*width:99.6%;float:left;"><div class="a-row a-nowrap"><div class="a-column a-span1"><span class="solicit-review fading-line"></span>

    <div class="a-section a-spacing-small page-content page-min-width"><script type="a-state" data-a-state="{&quot;key&quot;:&quot;review-summary-state&quot;}">{"csrfToken":"0.16337390961192233;1433520295730;gPPDML32kNcxY+/cgv5LIa/sEh8+5QC0exBwCeMAAAADAAAAAFVxyKdyYXcAAAAA","signinUrl":"https://www.amazon.com/ap/signin?openid.return_to=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FAH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire%2Fproduct-reviews%2FB0029HO66G%3FfilterByStar%3Dall_stars%26reviewerType%3Dall_reviews%26sortBy%3Dhelpful%26formatType%3Dall_formats&openid.identity=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0%2Fidentifier_select&openid.claimed_id=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0%2Fidentifier_select&openid.assoc_handle=usamazon&openid.mode=checkid_setup&openid.ns=http%3A%2F%2Fspecs.openid.net%2Fauth%2F2.0","ratingSubmissionAjaxUrl":"/gp/customer-reviews/aj/customer-and-asin/submit-rating-v2","asin":"B0029HO66G"}</script><div id="cm_cr-rvw_summary" class="a-fixed-right-grid celwidget a-spacing-large"><div class="a-fixed-right-grid-inner" style="padding-right:305px"><div id="cm_cr-rvw_summary-viewpoints" class="a-fixed-right-grid-col celwidget a-col-left" style="padding-right:1%;*width:98.6%;float:left;"><div class="a-row view-point"><div class="a-column a-span6 view-point-review positive-review"><div aria-live="polite" data-a-expander-collapsed-height="300" class="a-expander-collapsed-height a-row a-expander-container a-expander-partial-collapse-container" style="max-height:300px; _height:300px"><div aria-expanded="false" class="a-expander-content a-expander-partial-collapse-content"><div class="a-row a-ws-row"><h4 class="a-size-medium view-point-title">Most helpful positive review</h4></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:see-positive-critical" data-reviews:see-positive-critical="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_viewpnt_lft" data-reviews-param="{&quot;filterByStar&quot;:&quot;positive&quot;}" class="a-size-base a-link-normal see-all" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=positive&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats">See all 1,623 positive reviews</a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base back-carat a-text-bold">&rsaquo;&#32;</span></span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-mini"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">139 of 160 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-5 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">5</span></i><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base review-title a-text-bold">good speaker cable</span></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span>Retired Danny "RetiredDan"</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on October 26, 2009</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-mini"><span class="a-size-base">I am no pro but I can say that I can not tell the difference between this speaker cable and the more expensive stuff. I've been doing this sort of thing for many years and always used the more expensive cables but a friend, who is in the business, told me recently that copper wire is copper wire, no matter what company you buy it from and as long as the wire is shielded properly, why pay more? Made sense to me so I tried it and guess what? He was right! I don't have test devices to check OHM loss and all that stuff, only my ear and my ear tells me I can't tell the difference at any volume or range. Never too old to learn something new!</span></div></div><div
      class="a-expander-header a-expander-partial-collapse-header readMore">
    <div class="a-expander-content-fade"></div>
    <a class="a-size-base a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R3F4O8A3RUWKKX?ASIN=B0029HO66G#R3F4O8A3RUWKKX">Read more</a></div>
</div></div><div class="a-column a-span6 view-point-review critical-review a-span-last"><div aria-live="polite" data-a-expander-collapsed-height="300" class="a-expander-collapsed-height a-row a-expander-container a-expander-partial-collapse-container" style="max-height:300px; _height:300px"><div aria-expanded="false" class="a-expander-content a-expander-partial-collapse-content"><div class="a-row a-ws-row"><h4 class="a-size-medium view-point-title">Most helpful critical review</h4></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:see-positive-critical" data-reviews:see-positive-critical="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_viewpnt_rgt" data-reviews-param="{&quot;filterByStar&quot;:&quot;critical&quot;}" class="a-size-base a-link-normal see-all" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=critical&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats">See all 149 critical reviews</a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base back-carat a-text-bold">&rsaquo;&#32;</span></span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-mini"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">486 of 515 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-3 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">3</span></i><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base review-title a-text-bold">14 AWG should satisfy majority of installs</span></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span>FredMR "RADDFM"</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on November 4, 2011</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-mini"><span class="a-size-base">As stated, this is not pure copper...it is copper clad aluminum (CCA).  Cost is less, but that's because aluminum is cheaper and more resistive than copper.  I work as an engineer for a power company.  Lower voltage distribution power lines used to often be made from pure copper - however it is more cost effective to use aluminum or aluminum alloys... but since the resistance is greater for these wires, the wire gauge is increased - so you need thicker wires to accomplish the same thing...however this is more cost effective.  Same theory applies here...it's not pure copper, so ideally - you should use bigger wire than what your application would require if pure copper was used.<br /><br />General rule for 16 AWG wire is to keep runs at 48' or less.  Most runs aren't that long, so 16 AWG will even satisfy most short wire installs... having said that, if you purchase the 14 AWG CCA wire - I'd imagine runs of wire up to 50' would be acceptable.<br /><br />Some reasons to shop around include corrosion resistance found in oxygen free coppers.. The other issue is unlike my power industry example, this product isn't necessarily cost effective if you know where to shop...pure copper from bigger bargain sites (or even 12 AWG lamp cord from a local hardware store) are priced about the same as a roll of this 14 AWG wire sells for.  So....having said that, you might as well purchase a better quality product given the same cost and a choice between the two.</span></div></div><div
      class="a-expander-header a-expander-partial-collapse-header readMore">
    <div class="a-expander-content-fade"></div>
    <a class="a-size-base a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R1SS3D5KRIBBPF?ASIN=B0029HO66G#R1SS3D5KRIBBPF">Read more</a></div>
</div></div></div></div><div id="cm_cr-rvw_summary-ads" class="a-fixed-right-grid-col celwidget a-col-right" style="width:305px;margin-right:-305px;float:left;">

review"><div class="a-row helpful-votes-count"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">4 of 4 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><a class="a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R2CA2RVWUBEZWC?ASIN=B0029HO66G"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-5 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">5</span></i></a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base a-text-bold" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R2CA2RVWUBEZWC?ASIN=B0029HO66G">PLACE IT UNDER THE RUG</a></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" href="/gp/pdp/profile/A2KMLVZ5CPEBJI">DIGITALSHOOTER "Canon5D-man"</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on April 13, 2010</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" data-reviews:show-avp="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_rvw_rvwer" class="a-link-normal" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=avp_only_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-state a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">The title should explain what this review is about...I had a very heavy, very round and non pliable speaker cables, which had to cross the room due to speaker placement. The round cable was always a problem under the rug, actually causing some to trip or stumble when walking on it. Therefore, I ordered this flat-wire speaker cable for just this problem and in a few minutes, the problem was resolved, with no loss of signal to the rear speakers...More important, however, was the establishment where the cable was purchased...Very accommodating, genuinely concerned and great customer service, which from my perspective is as important as the product itself...There are many applications for this type of cable but do not be weary of the product or the retail vendor - A great deal from top to bottom.</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div  says 100' but only 93' 5"!</a></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" href="/gp/pdp/profile/AWSHAQOKUSO43">Big D</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on January 29, 2012</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal a-color-secondary" href="/RCA-AH16100SR-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HHIDY?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=current_format">Size: 16 gauge -  100 ft spool<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a><i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" data-reviews:show-avp="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_rvw_rvwer" class="a-link-normal" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=avp_only_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-state a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">Was right in the middle of a surround sound install, I needed 4 runs, 2x30 foot, 1x22 foot, and 1x18 foot, but after measuring/cutting the first 3 pieces, only 11'5" remained for a total of 93 feet 5 inches. And yes I double checked my measurements. Had to go to the Depot to buy more wire so I could finish the job, wasting more of my time, gas, and money. irritating to say the least. Guess they figure most people will never notice.</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_opn" aria-live="polite" </div><div class="a-section a-spacing-extra-large a-spacing-top-medium a-text-center comment-load-error a-hidden"><div class="a-box a-alert a-alert-error cr-error"><div class="a-box-inner a-alert-container"><h4 class="a-alert-heading">There was a problem loading comments right now. Please try again later.</h4><i class="a-icon a-icon-alert"></i><div class="a-alert-content"></div></div></div></div><div class="a-section a-spacing-none review-comments"></div><div class="a-section a-spacing-extra-large a-spacing-top-medium a-text-center comment-loading a-hidden"></div><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:more-comments" data-reviews:more-comments="{}"><span class="a-button a-button-small more-comments-button a-hidden"><span class="a-button-inner"><input data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_btn" class="a-button-input" type="submit"><span class="a-button-text" aria-hidden="true">Show more comments</span></span></span></span><hr class="a-spacing-none a-spacing-top-large a-divider-normal"></div></div></div></div><div id="R3LX8H0EW6QEPE" class="a-section review"><div class="a-row helpful-votes-count"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">3 of 3 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><a class="a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R3LX8H0EW6QEPE?ASIN=B0029HO66G"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-5 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">5</span></i></a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base a-text-bold" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R3LX8H0EW6QEPE?ASIN=B0029HO66G">Great For Home use!</a></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" href="/gp/pdp/profile/AH1GQAJLDEJZA">skydog</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on September 24, 2012</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal a-color-secondary" href="/AH1450SR-14-Gauge-Speaker-Wire-feet/product-reviews/B002JP4Z96?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=current_format">Length: 14 gauge -  50 ft spool<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a><i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" data-reviews:show-avp="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_rvw_rvwer" class="a-link-normal" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=avp_only_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-state a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">There has been some debate over the efficiency of this wire.  The idea that copper over aluminum makes an inferior speaker wire isn't relevant to most home users.  Due to the "skin effect" most of the electrons (AC Audio Signal)flow over the outside surface of each wire strand, in this case the copper.  Yes copper is a good conductor of AC audio signals and has been a traditional material for speaker wires.  If you want a better conductor than copper buy silver wire, if it even exists.  The problem is if you are an average home owner with the usual home AV configuration it just doesn't make sense to spend more money on expensive pure copper wire. Audiophiles like fly fishermen will spend crazy amounts of money on equipment and with the possible exception of shielded speaker cable and great hand tied fishing flies, it's just not worth the extra $$.  What is important is that you use a heavy enough gauge wire.<br /><br />Heavy gauge speaker wire is more durable, better insulated and will carry a heavier load over longer distances with less signal loss (lower resistance).  For most audio installations 16 gauge is fine.  I like 14 gauge because I know it will endure the pitfalls of home use such as being nibbled on by the cat and such.  The down side is it is not as flexible as 16 gauge speaker wire and that's OK with me.<br /><br />For those who want to know this wire is easily soldered using regular rosin core electrical solder.  Do not use acid core solder or the wire will corrode over time.  Instead of buying expensive wire pins to terminate your wire I perform a process known as "tinning".  I simply strip 1/2" of insulation from the wire and use a good hot soldering iron and apply solder to each wire end.  I then trim the ends to 3/8" length and they are ready to go.<br /><br />Would I recommend this product?  Absolutely.  Unless you spent $5000 on a dual mono block tube amp, then this wire should work just fine.  KB0QAQ</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_opn" aria-live="polite" data-a-expander-name="review_comment_expander" class="a-row a-expander-container a-expander-inline-container"><a href="javascript:void(0)" data-action="a-expander-toggle" class="a-expander-header a-declarative a-expander-inline-header a-link-expander" Please try again later.</h4><i class="a-icon a-icon-alert"></i><div class="a-alert-content"></div></div></div></div><div id="Tx1GP0BELESBLT9" class="a-section a-spacing-none type="submit"><span class="a-button-text" aria-hidden="true">Show more comments</span></span></span></span><hr class="a-spacing-none a-spacing-top-large a-divider-normal"></div></div></div></div><div id="R2RDDYHL35PF54" class="a-section review"><div class="a-row helpful-votes-count"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">3 of 3 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><a class="a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R2RDDYHL35PF54?ASIN=B0029HO66G"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-5 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">5</span></i></a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base a-text-bold" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R2RDDYHL35PF54?ASIN=B0029HO66G">Excellent quality, good price!</a></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" href="/gp/pdp/profile/A2594PNR8PGPRW">Phebe Hart "techno geek"</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on March 26, 2012</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal a-color-secondary" href="/AH1450SR-14-Gauge-Speaker-Wire-feet/product-reviews/B002JP4Z96?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=current_format">Length: 14 gauge -  50 ft spool<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">Im in process of setting up a 5.1 surround sound home theatre proj.  Id did some research as i always do before any purchase to see whats the best price and prod i can buy.  Audiovox is the company mfg this, I thought it was RCA seeing the big letters on the bottom of spool but its very nice and while 50 ft might have been almost enough, i went with the bigger role of 100'.  I always recommend going a bit more too as you think you need less and then need more and have to buy all over again.  However at $10 a roll, $20 for 100' is pretty good for this gauge and of such high quality.  Its recommended that you go 10' from ea other with speaker distance between L & R fronts so do the math as to length you need and you will know what your needs are.  In my research i found out the the purer the copper strands and the bigger AWG you could afford, the better the frequency.  Id highly recommend this 14 AWG gauge and the company, only thing better is the 12 AWG.  It comes on a nice plastic spool too which you could hang on a broom-like poll and pull down cutting off what you need.  I also bought a 12 AWG roll but Audiovox here on Amazon didnt have such a thickness at 100% copper otherwise i would have bought that instead so I had to go to another website of a company which i found on an audio blog (they sell alot of the good locking banana plugs here on Amazon) with cost of copper, silver, gold going up its only going to get more expensive so i bought a roll of 100' 12 AWG from that other company to test out which amounted to $48 for 12 AWG at 100'- only a $28 difference in cost, so 14 AWG at $20 for 100' is a pretty good deal.  There's a few good Youtube videos and audio sites w/videos as to how to match - (+) and install banana plugs if you desire, i did.  Im no audiophile or electrician.  I was able to do it fairly quickly.  I stripped 4 sides of two 10' strands and installed 1 pr of locking banana plugs on one side of ea strand.  I inserted in to my new Denon AVR 1912 receiver and tried tinning with a soldering iron to no luck and gave up tinning (my iron wasnt hot enough i guess, needed a better grade/hotter one).  Placed the spkr wire in to speakers and worked nicely.  Id recommend the Audiovox RCA 14 AWG copper wire highly.  Nice rubberized, transparent covering on wires too, one side has a white stripe running through..i decided that would be the + side and just made sure all connections were using the white stripe as positive and inserted in red clips on speakers and red inserts on AVR receiver the other went to neg and all blk inserts. I love doing tech projects and i love my movies, music so Im in heaven with this...hope this helps you. Great quality, good price!</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_opn" aria-live="polite" data-a-expander-name="review_comment_expander" class="a-row a-expander-container a-expander-inline-container"><a href="javascript:void(0)" data-action="a-expander-toggle" class="a-expander-header a-declarative a-expander-inline-header class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" ft spool<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a><i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">After ordering and starting to install this cable I found that it was about 15 to 20 feet short. Since I all ready cut a couple of lengths I felt that I could not return it, but I did not think to check a spool before using it. So if your looking for and expecting 100 feet of cable check the length before using.</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_opn" review"><div class="a-row helpful-votes-count"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">6 of 7 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><a class="a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R2TVESA6CR9MHV?ASIN=B0029HO66G"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-1 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">1</span></i></a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base a-text-bold" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R2TVESA6CR9MHV?ASIN=B0029HO66G">Do you like gold plated jewelry?</a></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" href="/gp/pdp/profile/A381C6UUUIAB4V">NoBS</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on May 7, 2013</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal a-color-secondary" href="/AH14100SR-14-Gauge-Speaker-Wire-feet/product-reviews/B002HPNDDW?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=current_format">Size: 14 gauge -  100 ft spool<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">I prefer the solid gold jewelry and solid copper speaker wire. I wouldn't mind so much if I was running some speakers in my garage that I got from the Goodwill, but if I want quality I should know. There is no mention that this is aluminum wire. If it is just as good, it should mention as much. How hard would it be to show a % loss running 50 feet of solid copper vs. 50 feet of CCA. Most people don't even know and RCA is happy to hide the facts. I don't mind paying more or less for something, but I do mind when I am deceived with sugar, err copper, coating.</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div     <div class="a-row a-spacing-none a-grid-vertical-align a-grid-center"><div class="a-column a-span6"><span class="a-size-base a-viewoptions-list-label">Showing <span class='review-comment-count'>0</span> of <span class='review-comment-total'>2</span> comments</span></div><div class="a-column a-span6 a-text-right a-span-last"><span class="a-size-base a-viewoptions-list-label">Sort by:<span class="a-letter-space"></span></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:sort-comments" data-reviews:sort-comments="{}"><li

        </span></div></div></ul>
</div><div class="a-section a-spacing-extra-large a-spacing-top-medium a-text-center comment-load-error a-hidden"><div class="a-box a-alert a-alert-error cr-error"><div class="a-box-inner a-alert-container"><h4 class="a-alert-heading">There was a problem loading comments right now. Please try again later.</h4><i class="a-icon a-icon-alert"></i><div class="a-alert-content"></div></div></div></div><div id="Tx3UH2O6SX8NZ70" class="a-section a-spacing-none review-comments"></div><div class="a-section a-spacing-extra-large a-spacing-top-medium a-text-center comment-loading a-hidden"></div><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:more-comments" data-reviews:more-comments="{}"><span class="a-button a-button-small more-comments-button a-hidden"><span class="a-button-inner"><input data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_btn" class="a-button-input" type="submit"><span class="a-button-text" aria-hidden="true">Show more comments</span></span></span></span><hr class="a-spacing-none a-spacing-top-large a-divider-normal"></div></div></div></div><div id="R3GCMKFZAQ8FB9" class="a-section review"><div class="a-row helpful-votes-count"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">3 of 3 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><a class="a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R3GCMKFZAQ8FB9?ASIN=B0029HO66G"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-5 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">5</span></i></a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base a-text-bold" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R3GCMKFZAQ8FB9?ASIN=B0029HO66G">It's copper clad, but so what?</a></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" href="/gp/pdp/profile/A1Z0C16TBC5S36">gearhead.pete</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on October 29, 2011</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal a-color-secondary" href="/AH14100SR-14-Gauge-Speaker-Wire-feet/product-reviews/B002HPNDDW?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=current_format">Size: 14 gauge -  100 ft spool<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a><i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" data-reviews:show-avp="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_rvw_rvwer" class="a-link-normal" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=avp_only_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-state a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">I purchased this 14 AWG wire for my Take Classic 5.1 speakers and Denon receiver.  I had used some preexisting Monster XP wire cabling for the recommended 50 hr break-in of the Take speakers, and cannot detect any difference in loudness for a given Denon volume setting with my new RCA wire hookup.<br /><br />Some reviews criticized this RCA wire for being CCA (copper clad aluminum).  Much (most) speaker wire today is CCA.  That is not as bad as it may seem to some.  If the price is less, and if the resistivity is acceptable, this should be a good buy.<br /><br />The AWG copper conductor wire specification includes both diameter and resistivity (e.g., ohms/meter). I checked the RCA 14 AWG wire diameter with the strands tightly twisted and it was about nominal (essentially meaningless).  I then checked the resistivity with my Fluke 289 DVM and the resistance was LESS than the 14 AWG spec (meaningful).<br /><br />Regarding the soldering... good crimp connectors would work just fine and eliminate soldering.  By force of habit, I tinned (applied solder to) the ends of my wires before inserting them into the speaker and Denon terminals.  The RCA 14 AWG CCA wire can be tinned and soldered without any difficulty.  BTW tinning turns the wire ends silver with solder.<br /><br />I am satisfied with my purchase.</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_opn" aria-live="polite" data-a-expander-name="review_comment_expander" class="a-row a-expander-container a-expander-inline-container"><a href="javascript:void(0)" data-action="a-expander-toggle" class="a-expander-header a-declarative a-expander-inline-header a-link-expander" data-a-expander-toggle="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:true, &quot;expand_prompt&quot;:&quot;&quot;, &quot;collapse_prompt&quot;:&quot;&quot;}"><i class="a-icon a-icon-expand"></i><span class="a-expander-prompt"><span class="review-comment-total a-hidden">0</span><span class="a-size-base">Comment</span></span></a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base cr-vote"><span _height:300px"><div aria-expanded="false" class="a-expander-content a-expander-partial-collapse-content"><div class="a-row a-ws-row"><h4 class="a-size-medium view-point-title">Most helpful positive review</h4></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:see-positive-critical" data-reviews:see-positive-critical="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_viewpnt_lft" data-reviews-param="{&quot;filterByStar&quot;:&quot;positive&quot;}" class="a-size-base a-link-normal see-all" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=positive&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats">See all 1,623 positive reviews</a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base back-carat a-text-bold">&rsaquo;&#32;</span></span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-mini"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">139 of 160 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-5 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">5</span></i><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base review-title a-text-bold">good speaker cable</span></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span>Retired Danny "RetiredDan"</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on October 26, 2009</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-mini"><span class="a-size-base">I am no pro but I can say that I can not tell the difference between this speaker cable and the more expensive stuff. I've been doing this sort of thing for many years and always used the more expensive cables but a friend, who is in the business, told me recently that copper wire is copper wire, no matter what company you buy it from and as long as the wire is shielded properly, why pay more? Made sense to me so I tried it and guess what? He was right! I don't have test devices to check OHM loss and all that stuff, only my ear and my ear tells me I can't tell the difference at any volume or range. Never too old to learn something new!</span></div></div><div
      class="a-expander-header a-expander-partial-collapse-header readMore">
    <div class="a-expander-content-fade"></div>
    <a class="a-size-base a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R3F4O8A3RUWKKX?ASIN=B0029HO66G#R3F4O8A3RUWKKX">Read more</a></div>
</div></div><div class="a-column a-span6 view-point-review critical-review a-span-last"><div aria-live="polite" data-a-expander-collapsed-height="300" class="a-expander-collapsed-height a-row a-expander-container a-expander-partial-collapse-container" style="max-height:300px; _height:300px"><div aria-expanded="false" class="a-expander-content a-expander-partial-collapse-content"><div class="a-row a-ws-row"><h4 class="a-size-medium view-point-title">Most helpful critical review</h4></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:see-positive-critical" data-reviews:see-positive-critical="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_viewpnt_rgt" data-reviews-param="{&quot;filterByStar&quot;:&quot;critical&quot;}" class="a-size-base a-link-normal see-all" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=critical&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats">See all 149 critical reviews</a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base back-carat a-text-bold">&rsaquo;&#32;</span></span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-mini"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">486 of 515 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-3 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">3</span></i><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base review-title a-text-bold">14 AWG should satisfy majority of installs</span></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span>FredMR "RADDFM"</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on November 4, 2011</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-mini"><span class="a-size-base">As stated, this is not pure copper...it is copper clad aluminum (CCA).  Cost is less, but that's because aluminum is cheaper and more resistive than copper.  I work as an engineer for a power company.  Lower voltage distribution power lines used to often be made from pure copper - however it is more cost effective to use aluminum or aluminum alloys... but since the resistance is greater for these wires, the wire gauge is increased - so you need thicker wires to accomplish the same thing...however this is more cost effective.  Same theory applies here...it's not pure copper, so ideally - you should use bigger wire than what your application would require if pure copper was used.<br /><br />General rule for 16 AWG wire is to keep runs at 48' or less.  Most runs aren't that long, so 16 AWG will even satisfy most short wire installs... having said that, if you purchase the 14 AWG CCA wire - I'd imagine runs of wire up to 50' would be acceptable.<br /><br />Some reasons to shop around include corrosion resistance found in oxygen free coppers.. The other issue is unlike my power industry example, this product isn't necessarily cost effective if you know where to shop...pure copper from bigger bargain sites (or even 12 AWG lamp cord from a local hardware store) are priced about the same as a roll of this 14 AWG wire sells for.  So....having said that, you might as well purchase a better quality product given the same cost and a choice between the two.</span></div></div><div
      class="a-expander-header a-expander-partial-collapse-header readMore">
    <div class="a-expander-content-fade"></div>
    <a class="a-size-base a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R1SS3D5KRIBBPF?ASIN=B0029HO66G#R1SS3D5KRIBBPF">Read more</a></div>

class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on May 8, 2011</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" data-reviews:show-avp="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_rvw_rvwer" class="a-link-normal" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=avp_only_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-state a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">Purchased this wire to run underneath my carpeting for the addition of some surround speakers.  Went to considerable trouble removing baseboards on both ends of the run and fishing a wire puller underneath the carpet and the carpet pad.  Was shocked after all this work to find that the 50' of cable that I needed to complete this job wasn't even close.  The reason this product is so cheap is that THEY ONLY SHIP YOU 31' OF CABLE.  This is a rip-off.  I went to Radio Shack and purchased a full 50' of 14-guage cable which was a much better product.  It was coiled nicely which kept it flat (this product was bent and kinked which defeated the purpose of being flat) and it was a full 50' as advertised.  Don't buy this rip off !!!</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_opn" aria-live="polite" data-a-expander-name="review_comment_expander"             <a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_lft" class="a-link-normal a-selected a-color-state" href="#">Newest</a></li>

</div><div class="a-section a-spacing-extra-large a-spacing-top-medium a-text-center comment-load-error a-hidden"><div class="a-box a-alert a-alert-error cr-error"><div class="a-box-inner a-alert-container"><h4 class="a-alert-heading">There was a problem loading comments right now. class="a-button a-button-small more-comments-button a-hidden"><span class="a-button-inner"><input data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_btn" class="a-button-input" type="submit"><span class="a-button-text" aria-hidden="true">Show more comments</span></span></span></span><hr class="a-spacing-none a-spacing-top-large a-divider-normal"></div></div></div></div><div id="R2VJVSH6L5SI52" class="a-section review"><div class="a-row helpful-votes-count"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">3 of 3 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><a class="a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R2VJVSH6L5SI52?ASIN=B0029HO66G"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-5 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">5</span></i></a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base a-text-bold" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R2VJVSH6L5SI52?ASIN=B0029HO66G">Great wire</a></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" href="/gp/pdp/profile/AUFOHZG3LP4LG">Kenneth Koers</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on November 12, 2010</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal a-color-secondary" href="/RCA-AH16100SR-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HHIDY?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=current_format">Size: 16 gauge -  100 ft spool<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a><i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" data-reviews:show-avp="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_rvw_rvwer" class="a-link-normal" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=avp_only_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-state a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">It wasn't nearly as expensive as some other *cough*Monster*cough* wires, but is the same thing. Wire's a pretty simple thing - stranded copper in a sheathing. The sheathing on this wire was very nice and thick, and as for the thickness of the wire itself; I needed to use the 14 awg stripper if I didn't want to pinch off some wire strands. Some people will argue that higher strand counts will give you better sound, which is crazy talk. The physics of that just doesn't work, the cross-sectional area is the same and that's what matters.</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div review"><div class="a-row helpful-votes-count"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">3 of 3 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><a ft.</a></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" href="/gp/pdp/profile/A5MSPH1TZMZE9">Ashley</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on December 5, 2011</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal a-color-secondary" href="/RCA-AH16100SR-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HHIDY?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=current_format">Size: 16 gauge -  100 ft spool<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a><i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" data-reviews:show-avp="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_rvw_rvwer" class="a-link-normal" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=avp_only_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-state a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">Like others have pointed out there are not 100 feet of wire here. I should have listened to those reviews because now I have to buy more wire elsewhere. The wire itself is fine, but it is falsely advertised as 100 ft. If you do not need that much wire and are attracted by the low price, this product will be fine, but I believe there are laws against false advertisement. I am not talking about a couple of feet less than 100. There are probably only about 60 feet of wire in this bobbin. How does that approximate to 100?</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_opn" aria-live="polite" Zolikoff</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on November 26, 2011</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal a-color-secondary" href="/RCA-AH16100R-feet-16-Gauge-Speaker/product-reviews/B000N7DY9Y?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=current_format">Size: 16 gauge -  100 ft hank<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a><i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" data-reviews:show-avp="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_rvw_rvwer" class="a-link-normal" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=avp_only_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-state a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">In terms of quality and price, you can't beat this cable.  Solid wire, snakes and strips easily.  I ordered two of this item, thinking I would need both to wire up my Onkyo 5400 HTIB surround sound speakers.  I should have measured the distances first, as I now have a LOT left over. If you don't have the patience for threading striped ends into a cramped space on the back of your receiver, you might look at purchasing some banana clips, but I was able to get this 16-gauge wire into the connectors just fine.</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_opn" aria-live="polite" data-a-expander-name="review_comment_expander" Mahar</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on October 28, 2009</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal a-color-secondary" href="/RCA-AH16100R-feet-16-Gauge-Speaker/product-reviews/B000N7DY9Y?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=current_format">Size: 16 gauge -  100 ft hank<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a><i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" data-reviews:show-avp="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_rvw_rvwer" class="a-link-normal" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=avp_only_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-state a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">This speaker wire is a great value at this price.  The sound quality is great compared to the 24 gauge wire I was using before, and for this price it is well worth the upgrade.  The positive and negative portions of the wire are clearly labeled and therefore very easily discernible. 100 feet was plenty for my medium sized room to run along side the floorboards and hides pretty well.<br />The only problem with this cable, as another reviewer commented, is it is not on a spindle and is  a little harder to manage, but seriously not a big problem.  Do yourself a favor and by this inexpensive great quality cable over any monster cable, unless you like overpriced wires where the differences are not audible to the human ear.</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_opn" aria-live="polite" data-a-expander-name="review_comment_expander" class="a-row a-expander-container </div><div class="a-section a-spacing-extra-large a-spacing-top-medium a-text-center comment-load-error a-hidden"><div class="a-box a-alert a-alert-error cr-error"><div class="a-box-inner a-alert-container"><h4 class="a-alert-heading">There was a problem loading comments right now. Please try again later.</h4><i class="a-icon a-icon-alert"></i><div class="a-alert-content"></div></div></div></div><div class="a-section a-spacing-none review-comments"></div><div class="a-section a-spacing-extra-large a-spacing-top-medium a-text-center comment-loading a-hidden"></div><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:more-comments" data-reviews:more-comments="{}"><span class="a-button a-button-small more-comments-button a-hidden"><span class="a-button-inner"><input data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_btn" class="a-button-input" type="submit"><span class="a-button-text" aria-hidden="true">Show more comments</span></span></span></span><hr class="a-spacing-none a-spacing-top-large a-divider-normal"></div></div></div></div><div id="R2RAG40C47ITRU" class="a-section review"><div class="a-row helpful-votes-count"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">2 of 2 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><a class="a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R2RAG40C47ITRU?ASIN=B0029HO66G"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-5 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">5</span></i></a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base a-text-bold" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R2RAG40C47ITRU?ASIN=B0029HO66G">Great product for the price! Transmits sound beautifully!</a></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" href="/gp/pdp/profile/A1BJOHHLG0D965">M.D. Edwards "Avid Aesthete"</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-link-normal a-text-normal c7y-badge-link 
      c7y-badge-vine-voice" href="/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&nodeId=14279681&pop-up=1#tr"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-link c7yBadgeAUI c7yTopDownDashedStrike c7y-badge-text a-text-bold">VINE VOICE</span></a></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on April 4, 2011</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal a-color-secondary" href="/RCA-AH16100R-feet-16-Gauge-Speaker/product-reviews/B000N7DY9Y?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=current_format">Size: 16 gauge -  100 ft hank<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a><i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" data-reviews:show-avp="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_rvw_rvwer" class="a-link-normal" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=avp_only_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-state a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">When I was getting all of the materials that I would need to set up my new surround sound system for my entertainment center (my first time doing anything like that), I wasn't sure what to go with in the way of 16 gauge speaker wire. I'd lucked out and gotten an&nbsp;<a class="a-link-normal" href="/Atlantic-Technology-FS-7-0-GLB-7-channel-surround-bar-Gloss-Black/dp/B002R5ABIW">Atlantic Technology FS-7.0-GLB 7-channel surround bar (Gloss Black)</a>, naively not realizing that I'd need a receiver and speaker wire to get the speaker bar to work (I know, I know, but I DID say that it was my first time setting something like this up!), so there began my search for all of the necessary parts.<br /><br />Once I saw that 16 gauge was what was needed for my surround bar, I started my search on Amazon, since the reviews here have rarely led me astray, and the pricing's always near-impossible to beat. I read the reviews for this product, and they are what sold me on this bundle of speaker wire, as opposed to a more pricey one, or wire that arrived coiled on a spool. None of that was necessary, and I figured, at quite a bit less than a twenty note, I really couldn't lose. Glad I risked it, because this speaker wire works beautifully!<br /><br />Almost all of my TV equipment is glossy black, right down to the&nbsp;<a class="a-link-normal" href="/SoundBar-Riser-Two/dp/B00415F712">SoundBar-Riser Two</a>&nbsp;that I recently added to cradle my surround bar and raise up my TV (the perfect completing piece to my setup). I didn't really think about how the clear casing on this wire would make it stand out a bit more, with almost everything else being black, but I honestly love the color of copper, and you really can't see the wire unless you look for it anyway, so no big worry there. Speaking of the plastic casing on this wire, it's very easy to split with a well-placed snip of the scissors, where you'll want to separate the positive side of the wire from the negative for proper connection to your speaker/s (something else I didn't realize I'd need to do until I figured it out, after reading the description in the product information). It DID take me quite some time to strip the thick plastic casing from the wires to expose the requisite 1/2" for connection to my speakers (I actually cut away about an inch of casing - better too much than too little, I figured, and I could always cut down the exposed wires if necessary), but as all I was using was an old pair of Fiskar scissors, and a few cheapie-cheapie needle nose pliers, I think it all went quite well. I'm sure proper and specific tools would help you get the job done faster, but I just went with what I had on-hand (making SURE that I twisted the exposed wires - it'll make it MUCH easier to get into the speaker's wire openings, and it'll ensure that the sound DOES stay sharp and clear).<br /><br />Once I had my seven wires prepped and ready to go (and the TWENTY-EIGHT ends exposed and twisted), it was very easy to connect my surround bar to the&nbsp;<a class="a-link-normal" href="/Onkyo-TX-SR508-7-1-Channel-Home-Theater-Receiver-Black/dp/B003BEDQQW">Onkyo TX-SR508 7.1-Channel Home Theater Receiver (Black)</a>&nbsp;that I'd bought for it. I can honestly say that I've never before enjoyed watching TV or listening to anything attached to it as much as I do now. I cut my wires on the long side - about 7' - but the sound is spectacular, and I can't imagine that I'm losing anything at the current length.<br /><br />LONG story short, if you're doing it yourself, and not sure what wire to go with, I don't think you could get a better bargain or crisper sound anywhere, for this price or more! Great product! And I have plenty left over for NEXT time! ; )</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_opn" aria-live="polite" aria-hidden="true">Show more comments</span></span></span></span><hr class="a-spacing-none a-spacing-top-large a-divider-normal"></div></div></div></div><div id="R35PCUQBZYMPKP" class="a-section review"><div class="a-row helpful-votes-count"><span class="a-size-small a-color-secondary review-votes">2 of 2 people found the following review helpful</span></div><div class="a-row"><a class="a-link-normal" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R35PCUQBZYMPKP?ASIN=B0029HO66G"><i class="a-icon a-icon-star a-star-5 review-rating"><span class="a-icon-alt">5</span></i></a><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base a-text-bold" href="/gp/customer-reviews/R35PCUQBZYMPKP?ASIN=B0029HO66G">Having the perfect wire for right situation...</a></div><div class="a-row"><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-byline"><span class="a-color-secondary">By</span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><a class="a-size-base a-link-normal author" href="/gp/pdp/profile/AZJO8DTXGB18C">AtrackAttack "Deal Sniper"</a></span><span class="a-declarative" data-action="cr-popup" data-cr-popup="{&quot;width&quot;:&quot;340&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Help&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:&quot;/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=cm_cr_dp_bdg_help?ie=UTF8&amp;nodeId=14279681&amp;pop-up=1#tr&quot;,&quot;height&quot;:&quot;340&quot;}"></span><span class="a-letter-space"></span><span class="a-size-base a-color-secondary review-date">on September 14, 2012</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-mini review-data"><a class="a-size-mini a-link-normal a-color-secondary" href="/RCA-AH16100SR-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HHIDY?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=all_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=current_format">Size: 16 gauge -  100 ft spool<i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i>Package Type: Standard Packaging</a><i class="a-icon a-icon-text-separator"></i><span class="a-declarative" data-action="reviews:show-avp" data-reviews:show-avp="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}"><a data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_rvw_rvwer" class="a-link-normal" href="/AH1650SR-Feet-16-Gauge-Speaker-Wire/product-reviews/B0029HO66G?filterByStar=all_stars&reviewerType=avp_only_reviews&sortBy=helpful&formatType=all_formats"><span class="a-size-mini a-color-state a-text-bold">Verified Purchase</span></a></span></div><div class="a-row review-data"><span class="a-size-base review-text">I bought this wire for my brothers dorm room setup. Myself being the tech savvy member of the family I usually set up all the electronics. He needed wire for his surround sound speakers and this wire was perfect for the job. You must remember just because this wire was good for me, doesn't mean it will be the same for you as well. Wire needs to be bought to meet the task it will be handling. For example:<br /><br />Speaker Impedance----8 Ohm Load---------4 Ohm Load<br />Wire Gauge------------Distance (ft)--------Distance (ft)<br />  18 AWG------------------10-------------------5<br />  *16 AWG-----------------20-------------------10<br />  14 AWG------------------35-------------------18<br />  12 AWG------------------60-------------------30<br />  10 AWG------------------100------------------50<br /><br />*(this is the gauge your looking at)<br />Chart provided by [...]<br /><br />So looking at the chart the higher (meaning number wise) the gauge, the shorter the distance that the wire can carry the sound properly. This is because as the wire gauge increases, the actual wire diameter decreases and the higher the loss of the wire will be over increased distance.<br /><br />In sound terms that means your speakers will become quieter as distance increases (Common sense right! Most of you folks probably knew that so thanks for bearing with but for the ones who didn't, hopefully you better understand.)<br /><br />Anyway, overall the quality of the wire was just fine, especially for the price, and it worked perfect as expected.</span></div><div class="a-row a-spacing-top-small review-comments"><div data-reftag="cm_cr_pr_cmt_opn" aria-live="polite" data-a-expander-name="review_comment_expander" class="a-row a-expander-container a-expander-inline-container"><a href="javascript:void(0)" data-action="a-expander-toggle" class="a-expander-header a-declarative a-expander-inline-header a-link-expander" data-a-expander-toggle="{&quot;allowLinkDefault&quot;:true, &quot;expand_prompt&quot;:&quot;&quot;, &quot;collapse_prompt&quot;:&quot;&quot;}"><i class="a-icon a-icon-expand"></i><span class="a-expander-prompt"><span class="review-comment-total a-hidden">0</span><span window.$Nav && $Nav.when('$').build('alert.appendMessage', function ($) {
  return function () {
